src:
Miami z Dragićem do druge zmage nad Atlanto v treh dneh
01 Nov 2019, 10:35 by STA

Košarkarji Miami Heat so v severnoameriški ligi NBA na gostovanju pri Atlanta Hawks zabeležili še drugo zmago nad tem moštvom v treh dneh. Tokrat je vročica slavila s 106:97, slovenski košarkar Goran Dragić pa je k zmagi s klopi prispeval štiri točke, skok in tri podaje. Prvenec v NBA pa je dočakal tudi Vlatko Čančar v dresu Denver Nuggets.



Goran Dragić Foto: Tamino Petelinsek/STA

ATLANTA > Na tekmi v Atlanti se je spet izkazal novinec vročice Kendrick Nunn, ki je z 28 točkami dosegel svoj strelski rekord kariere, skupno pa je na prvih petih tekmah v NBA dosegel 112 točk, kar je največ v zgodovini lige med vsemi igralci, ki jih niso izbrali na naboru NBA.
“To je po svoje kar neverjetno,” je dejal Nunn, pred tem košarkar univerze v Michiganu, in dodal: “Vse, kar sem potreboval, je bila priložnost.”
Tyler Herro, še en novinec v dresu vročice, ki je dobila štiri od petih tekem, je k zmagi dodal 17 točk.
Nunn in Herro sta izkoristila Jimmyja Butlerja, ki jima je podelil 11 žog, dosegel pa le pet točk, devet skokov, šest ukradenih žog in tri podaje.
Prvi strelec Atlante je bil Jabari Parker s 23 točkami, DeAndre Bembry je zbral 18 točk, deset skokov in osem podaj.
Naslednja tekma Miami čaka v noči na ponedeljek, ko bo v domači dvorani gostil Houston.
Prvenec v ligi NBA je dočakal tudi Vlatko Čančar, ki pa mu je trener Denverja, ekipa je s 107:122 izgubila na gostovanju pri New Orleans Pelicans, namenil le dve minuti, tako da je njegova statistika ostala prazna.
text:
Miami with Dragic to another win over Atlanta in three days
01 Nov 2019, 10:35 by STA

In the North American NBA League, the Miami Heat recorded their second victory over the team in three days. This time the fever was celebrated with 106: 97, and Slovenian basketball player Goran Dragic contributed four points, a jump and three passes to the bench. The NBA debut was also welcomed by Vlatko Cancar in the Denver Nuggets jersey.



Goran Dragic Photo: Tamino Petelinsek / STA

ATLANTA> Fever Kendrick Nunn turned up in the Atlanta game again, scoring 28 career points with 28 points, totaling 112 points in his first five NBA games, the most in league history among all players they were not picked on the NBA set.
"It's amazing in its own right," said Nunn, previously a University of Michigan basketball player, adding, "All I needed was an opportunity."
Tyler Herro, another freshman in the fever jersey who won four of her five matches, added 17 points to the victory.
Nunn and Herro took advantage of Jimmy Butler, who gave them 11 balls, scoring just five points, nine rebounds, six steals and three passes.
Atlanta's first shooter was Jabari Parker with 23 points, DeAndre Bembry collected 18 points, ten rebounds and eight passes.
Miami's next game awaits Monday night when it hosts Houston in the home court.
The NBA league debut was also welcomed by Vlatko Cancar, who, with Denver's coach losing the team with 107: 122 away from the New Orleans Pelicans, only devoted two minutes, leaving his statistics empty.
